messageBody:
On 27 Mar 2007 19:13:05 -0700, Jeff Langr <jeff@...> wrote:
> J. B. Rainsberger wrote:
> > This goes against the basic design of JUnit, which promotes test
> > isolation. The only thing I can think of to achieve this is
> System.exit().
>
> Which is something I had to deal with two days ago, while writing tests
> against a main method. System.exit(), unfortunately, has to be
> "extracted and overridden." Unless you know of another way.

Just forbid its use with a SecurityManager and catch the ensuing exception.

As for dependent tests, they are not incompatible with test isolation
(see how TestNG implements it) : if you can run any test method
without having to care what it depends on, you have maintained test
isolation.

--
Cédric
